newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates dip on excess funds.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates dip on excess funds.

text.p: Pakistan's money market rates dipped on Monday amid surplus funds, but are likely to rise on Tuesday after an announcement of auction of short-term federal bonds worth six billion rupees.
Liquidity from last week's surplus funds spilled over and the day started with overnight bids and offers at 1.0 and 2.0 percent respectively, a dealer at KASB & Co said.
The prevailing liquidity in the system compelled lenders to give in and place their funds at 1.0 percent, he said. The market closed at 1.0 percent.
